page.title: 09Buildings
page.content: The village gives the appearance of a typical English village and has a variety of building types.Parts of farm houses are wattle and daub (Wick End and North End) and at Bury End, Burdelys Manor has a 17th century panelled room.Some thatch remains (although much was lost in past fires) such as Wayside Cottage-8 Bedford Rd (mid-19th century). Many estate cottages were built of limestone with diamond-framed windows in mid-19th century for the Trevors of Bromham, such as 2,4,12,32, Bedford Rd, Manor cottage and Village Farm.The Crown built standard Crown cottages e.g. 1,3 16,18, Bedford Rd and Dropshort Farm. The Crown crest and "V.R."can still be seen on many.Some semi-detached and bungalows were built along the Bedford Rd in 1920's and some detached in '30s and only infill since 1945.
